body: When Nigem D., a college freshman, thinks about the kind of life he could be leading, he remembers his friend Burnell. The last time he heard about him, Burnell was in jail on charges of drug possession. They met at the Pleasantville Residential Treatment Center in Westchester County, N.Y., when both were 14. They had been sent there by the
title: The Neediest Cases; After a Troubled Start, a Teen-Ager Gets a Nudge Toward College

body: FORSETER-Kopel (Karl). Born January 5, 1911, Ottynier, Poland. Died December 27, 1998 Rockville, Md. Devoted and loving husband of the late Sylvia Forseter. Beloved father of Bernard and Annette Forseter, of Rockville, Md., Lee and David Silber of Los Angeles, Calif. and Murray and Gilda Forseter of White Plains, N.Y. Cherished grandfather of Eric,
title: Paid Notice: Deaths FORSETER, KOPEL

body: Adolescent granddaughters read rhyming poems, interrupting their verses to wipe away tears. A man still in pain from his own injuries wailed over his wife's coffin. Two other husbands were still in the hospital and could not attend. And Jana Tsatskina, who lost both her mother and her mother-in-law in the Christmas Eve bus crash, fainted several
title: As Shock Turns to Sorrow, Five Families Say Goodbye

body: MORE than two and a half years have passed since a stray calico carried her five kittens from a burning building in East New York, Brooklyn, and became the poster cat for heroic animals. Yet Scarlett remains an international celebrity. This month, the Sally Jessy Raphael show videotaped her at her Brooklyn home for a coming show, and PBS plans to
title: Fans, and Fancy Feast, for Scarlett the Hero Cat

body: ELBIRT-Jacob. On Dec. 25, 1998. Devoted husband of Laura. Beloved father of Morton and Paula. Cherished grandfather of Adam, Benjamin, David & Shira. Loving brother of Rachael and Helen. His lifelong devotion to the state of Israel and the Jewish people was served by his many charitable activities and his tireless leadership in Federation of
title: Paid Notice: Deaths ELBIRT, JACOB

body: With thousands of their comrades bearing grim witness, two young New York City firefighters were eulogized and buried yesterday, each hailed as a hero lost too soon to the grave, each mourned by a grieving family only four days before Christmas. The gray skies never lifted on a raw day that began in Middle Village, Queens, with the funeral of James
title: Grieving Comrades and Families Bury 2 Young Firefighters

body: Three New York City firefighters who were trying to rescue an elderly woman from her top-floor Brooklyn apartment were killed yesterday when a fireball engulfed them as it swept through the narrow hallway, fire officials said. The three members of Ladder Company 170 in Brooklyn fell to the floor and shouted, ''Mayday!'' over a radio. But fire
title: 3 Firefighters Die Trying to Rescue a Woman in Brooklyn

body: MOSKOWITZ - Anne. Devoted wife of the late Samuel, longtime Flatbush dentist. Loving mother of Peter Warren and David Warren. Dear sister of the late Sylvia Neugeborn. Adored grandmother of Molly, Roslyn and Samantha. Services 12:30, today, Nieberg Midwood Chapel, 1625 Coney Island Ave., Brooklyn (Ave. M).
title: Paid Notice: Deaths MOSKOWITZ, ANNE

body: FIFTY years ago, my father was appointed principal of an elementary school near the Brooklyn Navy Yard. He was 44. It was his first command. That's how he has always regarded being a principal; it was like being captain of a ship, he said. This may be why, while waiting for my mother to emerge from life-support, he urges us to read his Patrick
title: COPING; A Captain In Rough Waters

body: RUBIN-RICE-Tammy. With deepest sorrow we announce the death of Tammy Rubin-Rice. She fought a valiant battle against breast cancer but succumbed at age 34. She will be forever missed by all whose lives she touched. Funeral services at Midwood Chapel, 1625 Coney Island Ave, Brooklyn, NY, 12 Noon on Wednesday. RUBIN-RICE-Tammy Hope. 34 of Miami,
title: Paid Notice: Deaths RUBIN, RICE, TAMMY

body: At this time last season, Curtis of Staten Island came into the Public Schools Athletic League title game as the top-seeded team and the overwhelming favorite against Tottenville. title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL; 1 Year and 2 Overtimes Later, Curtis Gets Title

body: SEVERAL years ago, John Acierno woke up in his four-bedroom Colonial in the prosperous Long Island community of Manhasset with the kind of primal scream heard in a growing number of suburban homes these days: ''What am I doing out here?'' His children had moved out, leaving him and his wife, Roberta, with three bedrooms where no one was sleeping.
title: Our Towns; Suburbanites Heed the Call Of the City

body: When Lorian Baker learned that her wire-haired terrier, Piccola, had inoperable cancer, she was devastated. ''I was so not ready for anything like this,'' said Ms. Baker, a technical writer who lives in Los Angeles. ''This dog was the center of my life.'' Ms. Baker, whose dog died on Sept. 28, said she was helped by logging onto the Web site of the
title: NEW YORK ON LINE; Saying Farewell to Fido

Last week, Councilman Anthony D. Weiner, a Brooklyn Democrat, was elected to the House, and Councilman John
title: Special Elections for City Council Are Ahead

body: C.H.S.F.L. Mount St. Michael, which has struggled in its three-peat bid this season, put the Catholic High Schools Football League on notice yesterday by upsetting Chaminade (6-1), New York State's eighth-ranked team, 22-16. Mount (4-2), the league's two-time defending champion, rallied from a 13-point halftime deficit and scored the winning
title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL; Mount St. Michael Pulls A Stunner on Chaminade

title: Paid Notice: Deaths ROSENBERG, ROSE

body: A study described as the first comprehensive survey of the conditions of New York City's streets confirms what drivers may have suspected: Many of the city's streets are in pretty bad shape. The survey, conducted by the Fund for the City of New York, rated 40 percent of the city's streets ''poor'' or ''terrible.'' The group also found that a driver
title: Private Survey on Street Quality Conflicts With Mayor's

body: There were silent tears when friends rose to read homespun recollections of the sweetness and merriment of three children who had died. There were sniffles and whispered prayers when the minister exhorted the mourners to have faith in God. But when six burly men in tuxedos and white gloves solemnly pushed carts carrying the small white coffins up
title: Mourning 3 'Cherubs' Killed by Ambulance

body: Long Island In a battle of unbeatens in Nassau County Conference II, Garden City defeated New Hyde Park, 20-14, yesterday on the last play of the game. With three seconds remaining, Matt Casey, the Trojans' senior quarterback, hit Dan Doherty with a 47-yard bomb down the left sideline to provide Garden City (5-0) with the winning margin. In a
title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL; Lightning Strikes Late And Lifts Garden City

body: New Jersey Ramapo (4-0), led by its two Division I prospects, Greg Toal and Chris Simms, humbled Ramsey (0-4) by 56-6 yesterday. It was the Raiders' 16th consecutive victory. Toal, who has signed with Boston College, had 19 carries for 161 yards and 5 touchdowns. Simms, the nation's No. 1-rated prep quarterback and the son of the former Giants
title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL; Ramapo Rolls Along Behind Its Two Stars

body: A New York Post delivery truck crashed into a Brooklyn apartment building yesterday morning, knocking out one of the building's support columns and causing 76 people to be evacuated, the authorities said. The 5:30 A.M. accident occurred at the corner of Coney Island Avenue and Avenue N in Midwood, said Jerry Hauer, director of the Mayor's Office of
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Newspaper Truck Hits Building in Brooklyn

body: Long Island Bellport, the defending Long Island Class 2 champion, rallied with two touchdowns in the final five minutes yesterday to earn a 20-20 tie with West Islip. With 13 seconds remaining, the senior quarterback Craig Bazarewski (5 of 12 for 133 yards) capped an 11-play, 69-yard drive with a 13-yard scoring strike to Neil Heaton. Mike Martin
title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL; With Time the Enemy, Bellport Salvages a Tie

body: Two children died after the car they were riding in collided with a private ambulance late last night in Brooklyn, the police said. Two other children riding in the car, its driver, and two emergency medical technicians were injured in the accident, which occurred at 11:55 p.m. The names and ages of the victims were not available last night. Jerry
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; 2 Children Killed And 5 Hurt in Accident

body: Two electronics stores in New York City have repeatedly bilked customers by passing off used computers as new ones, misrepresenting products in advertising and sales pitches and attracting customers through bait-and-switch tactics, the Department of Consumer Affairs said yesterday. Officials of the department said they had taken legal steps to
title: Agency Says Two Computer Stores Cheated Customers

body: After a week of being assailed in television advertising as a ''liberal Brooklyn Congressman'' hostile to upstate interests, Charles E. Schumer campaigned across western and central New York today, ticking off the names of relatives who had lived there and blaming Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato for the economic decline that has gripped this region.
title: Schumer Tours Upstate to Counter Attacks by D'Amato

body: In a contentious, four-way race, Anthony D. Weiner, a 34-year-old City Councilman from Brooklyn, won the Democratic primary for the seat to succeed Representative Charles E. Schumer in Congress by a razor-thin margin this morning. With all of the precincts reporting, Mr. Weiner, who had 12,569 votes, or 28 percent, won by a margin of 285 votes over
title: THE 1998 CAMPAIGN: CONGRESS; Weiner Is Victor Over Katz In Bid to Replace Schumer

body: Having shepherded his 33 freshmen into their first mathematics class of the school year, Richard Mesaric started his lesson, his voice loud but halting. ''There's something maybe a little special about me which I want to tell you about at the beginning,'' the teacher said as he looked around the third-floor classroom at Midwood High School in
title: Today's Lesson: What's a Bagel?; Austrians Fill a Need for Teachers and Learn the Lingo

body: At least one unidentified gunman fired into a crowd early yesterday in the Midwood section of Brooklyn, killing a 33-year-old man and wounding three other people, one of them critically, the police said. There were no arrests in the 2:05 A.M. shooting at Coney Island Avenue near Avenue M. Detective Walter Burnes, a Police Department spokesman, said
title: Shots Fired Into Brooklyn Crowd, Killing One and Wounding 3

body: New York's State Legislature is mostly a closed shop, where incumbents are protected by a complex petitioning process and an unfair fund-raising system. But there are a few competitive primary contests in New York City on Sept. 15. Here are our recommendations in 10 races in overwhelmingly Democratic districts where nomination is tantamount to
title: Choices for the State Legislature

body: IF I never answer your letter or fax, respond to your invitation or comment on your manuscript, you may now learn the reason why. Of course it will be only the surface reason. I am still searching for the deeper reason, with my religious advisers. As you may remember, seven weeks ago the sewer backed up into my apartment. Because I use my floor as
title: COPING; Time to Build The Ark?

title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: NEW YORK UP CLOSE; A Beach Blanket Bazaar

body: Jennifer Corbin, a 28-year-old Midwood, Brooklyn, woman who the police said was sprayed with flammable liquid and set on fire by her husband, died at 4:45 P.M. Wednesday at Staten Island University Hospital, city officials said. Her husband, Vere Corbin, 44, a real estate salesman, had been charged Wednesday with arson and attempted murder. After
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Man Who Burned Wife Is Charged With Murder

body: A Brooklyn man accused of spraying his wife with a flammable liquid and lighting her on fire before fleeing with the couple's twin sons was charged with attempted murder and arson yesterday, officials said. The woman, Jennifer Corbin, 28, was left critically injured from her burns following the Tuesday attack. A law enforcement official, who spoke
title: Brooklyn Man Charged With Setting Wife on Fire

body: To the Editor: The article ''A Suburban Enclave in an Urban Setting'' [July 5], about Ditmas Park in Brooklyn, makes several references to a ''greater Ditmas Park,'' including on the accompanying map, and even quotes a homeowner in another neighborhood as saying that her own neighborhood ''should be placed under the Ditmas Park mantle 'unless you
title: Greater Ditmas Park Or West Midwood?

body: ''Bomb Alert,'' says one. ''Ground Zero'' and ''Enter Area at Own Risk,'' proclaim two others. Embedded in the front lawns of the neat homes along East 32d Street in Midwood, the brightly lettered signs are but three of eight that warn passers-by of impending disaster. A nuclear meltdown, perhaps? Not exactly. Instead, for many residents of this
title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: MIDWOOD; Oxygen Tank Threat Seen

body: JOHN and Raelea Sharpe of South Caulfield, Australia, wanted an unstructured vacation in the United States, but on one detail they were inflexible: no hotels. ''For the past 35, 40 years, I've been traveling internationally and staying in six-star hotels,'' said Mr. Sharpe, a retired clothing importer. ''I'm all hoteled out. I hate hotels. I'm
title: NEW YORKERS & CO.; Mom, There Are Two Australians in the Bedroom!

body: A PROBLEM of definition arises with Ditmas Park, an area of Flatbush known for jumbo-sized, richly detailed, nearly century-old Colonial Revival houses and ever-increasing ethnic diversity. In the strictest sense, Ditmas Park is made up of the Ditmas Park historic district, a few adjoining streets and a slightly less expensive companion
title: If You're Thinking of Living In/Ditmas Park, Brooklyn; A Suburban Enclave in an Urban Setting

body: CLARK HALSTEAD, founder of the real estate brokerage that bears his name, sees a certain similarity between the current quest for a rental apartment in New York City and the five stages of death and dying so poignantly delineated in Elisabeth Kubler-Ross's classic 1969 book on the subject: Denial. Anger. Bargaining. Depression. And, ultimately,
title: In 'Rent' 1998, the Renters Sing the Blues

The case arose when Premier House -- a 185-unit co-op in Midwood -- and three of its directors were charged with
title: YOUR HOME; A Board's Liability In a Lawsuit

Mr. Morale, who was taking heart medication, had a heart attack a few minutes later and
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Manslaughter Charge Is Dropped in Beating

Among some Pakistanis, there was a heady rush of competitiveness. After an
title: In New York, Emotional Fallout From India's Nuclear Tests

body: Midwood High School prides itself on a culture of achievement. Students come from outside the district for its special humanities and premed programs. title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: MIDWOOD; School Aide's Death Grows Into Case of Multiple Mysteries

author: Mimi Sheraton is a former restaurant critic for The New York Times. Her latest book is ''Food Markets of the World'' (Abrams).
body: It has always seemed both exciting and practical to take a sightseeing bus tour through a strange city, as I have done many times. But a bus tour through my lost youth? Now there's a trip I wouldn't miss for the world, I thought, when New York Apple Tours announced its first foray into my native Brooklyn. Not that the red-and-yellow, double-decker,
title: Touring the Heart's Own Brooklyn

body: Few, if any, tornadoes have ever struck Queens. But on Thursday, something much like a tornado blew into the borough, in the back of a strange truck. In a city that has seen an endless number of publicity stunts, an 18-wheeler toting a wind tunnel to promote Twister, a new ride at a Florida theme park, might seem routine. But the truck arrived
title: Twister in a Truck On a Whirlwind Tour

title: PUBLIC LIVES; District Thaws to School Superintendent

The two-month show thrust those featured onto the international art scene, catapulted awareness of the genre to a
title: Haitian Art Bursting Out

Mr. Dear, who represents the Borough Park section of Brooklyn, raised $397,600 in the three
title: Race for Seat Of Schumer Grows Costly

body: SATURDAY is not Nathilee Caldeira's Sabbath, yet she feels a certain reverence for the day. As Orthodox Jews dressed for worship walk to synagogues, she and other blacks in the neighborhood go about their business. They do so with an understanding that it is a sacred day. ''Somehow on Saturdays, nobody really gets crazy,'' she said. Sunday is Ms.
title: Old Places, New Faces

body: Boys and Girls High School of Brooklyn finished first and third yesterday in the 1,600-meter relay to edge South Shore of Brooklyn for the boys' team title in the eighth annual Kings Relays at Midwood Field, Brooklyn. The 9 relay points gave Boys and Girls 33 points to South Shore's 32. Campus Magnet of Queens took the girls' team crown with 38
title: Boys and Girls First in Relays

body: In spring 1996, the Open Housing Center, a nonprofit fair-housing organization in Manhattan, received an anonymous telephone call about a Bay Ridge realtor. title: NEIGHBORHOOD REPORT: BAY RIDGE/BENSONHURST; Lawsuit Charges Landlord Had No Vacancies -- for Blacks

body: If there was one swatch of New York City that epitomized the shift in power that decentralization brought to the public school system 30 years ago, it was the neighboring Brooklyn communities of Ocean Hill and Brownsville. It was there that one of the first community school boards was born, and where angry parental demands for control led to a
title: Crew Imposes His Nominee On a Board

body: MILLER-Josephine. The Sanders, Katz and Fischl families of Midwood, Brooklyn, note with deep sadness the passing of our close friend, Josephine. Her warmth and good humor will be missed by all of us, and we send our sincerest condolences to her family.
title: Paid Notice: Deaths MILLER, JOSEPHINE

body: Seeking to rein in what he described as a recalcitrant school board, Schools Chancellor Rudy Crew temporarily unseated the members of Community School Board 23 in Brooklyn yesterday because they had refused to appoint his first-choice candidate for district superintendent. In following the procedures of the new school governance law, the board,
title: METRO NEWS BRIEFS: NEW YORK; Crew Overrides Board In Picking School Chief

body: Parker Rouse Conrad, 17, has spent nearly a year studying the brain cells of a creature called aplysia, known more commonly as the sea snail. Yesterday, his research won him third place and a $20,000 scholarship in the 57th annual Westinghouse Science Talent Search, the nation's top contest for aspiring scientists. But Mr. Conrad, a senior at the
title: 3 New Yorkers Make Top 10 in Science Competition

body: THEY are on the subway. Wherever lines form. In court. At the movies. Casually walking down the street. Knitters. All over New York, there seem to be more of them, feverishly working needles, their yarn discreetly tucked in a bag by their side, on their lap or even in a pocket. ''We've noticed a surge,'' said Linda Stanyon, the co-owner of a yarn
title: NEW YORKERS & CO.; Needles Click to a Younger Beat

body: Esther Wolf Lopato, a child psychologist who was active in civic affairs in Brooklyn and beyond, particularly on behalf of public libraries, died on Jan. 7 at her home in the Midwood neighborhood of Brooklyn. She was 77. She had suffered a long illness, her family said. At her death, Dr. Lopato was a trustee of the Brooklyn Public Library. She was
title: E. Lopato, 77, Psychologist And a Champion of Libraries

body: For the first time in the 57-year history of the Westinghouse science awards -- a prestigious ticket to college and even to Nobel Prizes for generations of students -- a more or less ordinary Brooklyn magnet school has not only outranked schools in the rest of the country, but also triumphed over New York City's two most elite public schools.
title: 13 Midwood High Students Take Westinghouse Honors

body: New Defiance From Iraq Two months after Iraq provoked a confrontation by expelling U.S. arms inspectors, it threatened to block a new team led by an American. The United Nations official in charge said the inspections would go on. Page A4. Reducing the Sting of Time New actuarial studies and findings that life spans are easier to manipulate than
title: INSIDE

body: ON Avenue M in Midwood, Brooklyn, the sidewalks bustle with Orthodox Jewish women in wigs and ankle-length skirts, while bearded men in long black coats and broad-brimmed hats walk to synagogue. Nestled among the other shops on the busy thoroughfare -- a kosher fish market, a Judaica bookshop and a bagel store -- sits Lavender Lace, an intimate
title: Where Lingerie Sells to the Orthodox

body: A Brooklyn teen-ager accused of beating a teacher's aide in November was charged with manslaughter after autopsy results linked the beating to the man's fatal heart attack, according to an indictment released by the Kings County District Attorney's office yesterday. According to the indictment, Jose Hiraldo, 16, a former special education student
title: New Charges in Beating Linked to a Heart Attack

body: Years ago, a Hasidic businessman, now the garrulous father of 14, had made enough money as a salesman to flee Borough Park for a leafy suburb with grand, commodious houses. But he stayed put, expanding his Brooklyn home forward, backward, upward and even downward until it morphed into an urban mansion, complete with household staff and voice-mail
title: Orthodox Neighborhood Reshapes Itself

body: John Turco has never met a piece of furniture he did not want to pounce on. The sofas in his mother's house, their legs broken, list like sinking ships. The dining room chairs are long gone, shattered beneath his 200-pound frame. His brand-new bed ''is now history,'' as his mother put it. ''What did you do to that bed?'' Maureen Turco asked him as
title: The Neediest Cases; Giving Order to a Boy's Tangled Life

body: On the eve of his second, and by law his last, term as Mayor of New York City, Rudolph W. Giuliani sauntered into a Times Square office tower last night with hundreds of his closest advisers, friends and fund-raisers and watched not only the traditional midnight ball drop, but also what the Mayor called an educational film: Francis Ford Coppola's
title: Facing Term 2 With 'Godfather,' Part One
